intro: Bonellia albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered bonellia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its flowers are hermaphroditic, containing both male and female reproductive organs. Bonellia albiflora is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
